comment: Tests for Divert struct filtering rules with ReconnectSSL, HTTP request headers: SSLproxy, Connection, Upgrade, Keep-Alive, Accept-Encoding, Via, X-Forwarded-For, and Referer

1.comment: Divert struct filtering rule removes any extra SSLproxy line, and appends Connection: close
ReconnectSSL rules cause sslproxy to disconnect/reconnect to the server, so the reconnect cmd instructs the server to allow it

2.payload:
GET / HTTP/1.1
Host: example.com
SSLproxy: sslproxy

3.payload:
GET / HTTP/1.1
Host: example.com
Connection: close

2.comment: Divert struct filtering rule removes all extra SSLproxy lines

2.payload:
GET / HTTP/1.1
Host: example.com
SSLproxy: sslproxy
SSLproxy: sslproxy

3.payload:
GET / HTTP/1.1
Host: example.com
Connection: close

3.comment: Divert struct filtering rule changes Connection header to close

2.payload:
GET / HTTP/1.1
Host: example.com
Connection: Keep-Alive

3.payload:
GET / HTTP/1.1
Host: example.com
Connection: close

4.comment: Divert struct filtering rule suppresses upgrading to SSL/TLS, WebSockets or HTTP/2

2.payload:
GET / HTTP/1.1
Host: example.com
Upgrade: websocket

3.payload:
GET / HTTP/1.1
Host: example.com
Connection: close

5.comment: Divert struct filtering rule removes Keep-Alive

2.payload:
GET / HTTP/1.1
Host: example.com
Keep-Alive: keep-alive

3.payload:
GET / HTTP/1.1
Host: example.com
Connection: close

6.comment: Divert struct filtering rule removes Accept-Encoding

2.payload:
GET / HTTP/1.1
Host: example.com
Accept-Encoding: encoding

3.payload:
GET / HTTP/1.1
Host: example.com
Connection: close

7.comment: Divert struct filtering rule removes Via

2.payload:
GET / HTTP/1.1
Host: example.com
Via: via

3.payload:
GET / HTTP/1.1
Host: example.com
Connection: close

8.comment: Divert struct filtering rule removes X-Forwarded-For

2.payload:
GET / HTTP/1.1
Host: example.com
X-Forwarded-For: x-forwarded-for

3.payload:
GET / HTTP/1.1
Host: example.com
Connection: close

9.comment: Divert struct filtering rule removes Referer

2.payload:
GET / HTTP/1.1
Host: example.com
Referer: referer

3.payload:
GET / HTTP/1.1
Host: example.com
Connection: close
